snippet: Sindh Province has become a target for Islamist groups, which are harassing religious minorities and using schools to propagate their radical vision.
abstract: Islamist groups have made alarmingly rapid inroads in Pakistan's southern region, long considered a bastion of tolerance and diversity, bringing violence in their wake; groups have been exploiting weaknesses in Pakistan's education system and legal code as part of a campaign to persecute minorities and spread their radical brand of Sunni Islam.

byline.original: By SABA IMTIAZ and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Saba Imtiaz reported from Mirpurkhas, and Declan Walsh from London.

lead_paragraph: Sindh Province has become a target for Islamist groups, which are harassing religious minorities and using schools to propagate their radical vision.

headline.main: Extremists Make Inroads in Pakistan’s Diverse South
headline.print_headline: Extremists Make Inroads in Pakistan’s Diverse South
